dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4490 IH: Providing Appropriate Recognition and Treatment Needed to Enhance Relations Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Castro of Texas (for himself, Mrs. Kim, Mr. Olszewski, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mr. Case, Mrs. Radewagen, Mr. Foster, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, and Mr. Meeks) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the International Organizations Immunities Act to extend diplomatic privileges and immunities to certain additional international and regional organizations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Providing Appropriate Recognition and Treatment Needed to Enhance Relations Act or the PARTNER Act.

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 2. Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations.
Sec. 3. Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the European Organization For Nuclear Research (CERN).
Sec. 4. Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Pacific Islands Forum.
Sec. 5. Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Caribbean Community.
Sec. 6. Extension of certain privileges and immunities to the African Union.

section.header: Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations
section.text: The International Organizations Immunities Act (22 U.S.C. 288 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations
section.text: Under such terms and conditions as the President shall determine, the President is authorized to extend the provisions of this title to the Association of Southeast Asian Nations in the same manner, to the same extent, and subject to the same conditions, as it may be extended to a public international organization in which the United States participates pursuant to any treaty or under the authority of any Act of Congress authorizing such participation or making an appropriation for such participation.

section.header: Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the European Organization For Nuclear Research (CERN)
section.text: The International Organizations Immunities Act (22 U.S.C. 288 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the European Organization For Nuclear Research (CERN)
section.text: Under such terms and conditions as the President shall determine, the President is authorized to extend the provisions of this title to the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN) in the same manner, to the same extent, and subject to the same conditions, as it may be extended to a public international organization in which the United States participates pursuant to any treaty or under the authority of any Act of Congress authorizing such participation or making an appropriation for such participation.

section.header: Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Pacific Islands Forum
section.text: The International Organizations Immunities Act (22 U.S.C. 288 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Pacific Islands Forum
section.text: Under such terms and conditions as the President shall determine, the President is authorized to extend the provisions of this title to the Pacific Islands Forum in the same manner, to the same extent, and subject to the same conditions, as it may be extended to a public international organization in which the United States participates pursuant to any treaty or under the authority of any Act of Congress authorizing such participation or making an appropriation for such participation.

section.header: Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Caribbean Community
section.text: The International Organizations Immunities Act (22 U.S.C. 288 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Extension of diplomatic privileges and immunities to the Caribbean Community
section.text: Under such terms and conditions as the President shall determine, the President is authorized to extend the provisions of this title to the Caribbean Community in the same manner, to the same extent, and subject to the same conditions, as it may be extended to a public international organization in which the United States participates pursuant to any treaty or under the authority of any Act of Congress authorizing such participation or making an appropriation for such participation.

section.header: Extension of certain privileges and immunities to the African Union
section.text: Section 12(b) of the International Organizations Immunities Act (22 U.S.C. 288f–2(b)) is amended:

paragraph.text: by striking to extend, or enter into an agreement to extend, to the African Union Mission and inserting to extend, or enter into an agreement to extend—;
by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

to the permanent observer mission of the African Union to the United Nations in New York, and to its members, the privileges and immunities enjoyed by the permanent missions to the United Nations of member states, and their members, subject to corresponding conditions and obligations.
